content:
Several developing countries around the world are benefiting from these initiatives aimed at providing access to clean water. Some of the countries where these initiatives are being implemented include:

1. Sub-Saharan Africa - this region has a high water poverty index and is often one of the areas most affected by water scarcity. Countries such as Ethiopia, Ghana, and Kenya are among those benefiting from the initiatives.

2. South Asia - countries such as India, Bangladesh, and Pakistan, where access to clean water is a major issue, are also benefiting from these initiatives.

3. Central and South America - countries such as Bolivia, Guatemala, and Peru are among those benefiting from the initiatives aimed at improving access to clean water.

Overall, these initiatives are targeting countries where safe water access is a major challenge due to factors such as infrastructure, political instability, poverty, and climate change.
